data.title: Nice place
data.text: We saw "Evita", and it was just perfect seats are really quit OK, you can see everything it's a cozy little theater but it was worth it.

data.title: THe Evils of History Continue On and On
data.text: Excellent! Haussman portrays the darkside of humanity that has prevailed for centuries.WHen evil people become empowered through inimidaton , violence, brutality and murder, the victims suffer, fear for their lives and try desperatel to escape if they can. From the early times of the Romans occupying Judea, torturing the citizenry  to the Midlle Ages with the Crusades to the Inquisition in Spain to Nazi Germany and on to Havana in the 50's, evil pervaded the lives of those seeking and obtaining power while good and innocent people were victimized and even killed., Will such horrible events ever stop being repeated?

data.title: Nice cozy theater
data.text:
We saw the Golam of Havana at this theater and the seats are preety good from almost everywhere. It is a small theater so buy tickets in advance. It is located right on Lincoln road so you can walk around, shop and eat before or after show.
Very nice!

data.title: Top Notch Theater
data.text: Very nice, small theater. Great vibe, comfortable seat, though not too wide. The bar is not really a bar, just a tiny counter. But there are plenty of bars on either side. We saw "The Golem of Havana", great venue for that show. The theater is part of Miami Beach history, before it was trendy.  I highly recommend going to a show there, easy parking, easy drinks and dinner. Fantastic people watching outside.

data.title: Decent little Theater in the Heart of the Beach
data.text: This is a lovely little theater in the heart of Miami Beach but other than having a retro look and feel to it there is nothing extraordinarily special about this place. It is a good spot to stop and take a few Photos of it.

data.title: Amateur hour
data.text: Most of the shows we have seen here have been like an Amateur Hour performance, low budget and low talent.  A French revue had 4 or 5 performers of dubitable quality.  An opera performance featured a motley chorus that was mostly offkey.  Of course, it's inexpensive, so I guess you get what you pay for.

data.title: a treasure on the beach
data.text: if you have a chance to catch a show here, go for it. Iconic theatre of SoBe, this is 300-400 seat beautiful theatre. Next to Segafredo so either before or after you can enjoy great cocktails, music and beautiful people. A great way to spend a night on Lincoln Road.

data.title: Saw "At Midnight" Live
data.text: The theater is located right on Lincoln Rd which allowed us to enjoy all of the things that has to offer. We watched a show which was great!! I was expecting more Art Deco on the inside, but the theater was small and intimate which I enjoyed.

data.title: Viva Paris International Show
data.text:
Viva Paris Show returns to the Colony Theater during Valentine's Week-end. Producer Erika Moon brings evolution in the production. Can`t wait to attend for this special week-end !
Of course it is not a broadway type of show, it's more like a sneek-Peek of Parisian Moulin Rouge type of show, something new in Miami. I will recommend if you want to have an entertaining evening.

data.title: Viva Paris
data.text: We went to see the Paris Review for Valentine's Day.  The show was interesting and entertaining, but a bit amateurish.  The venue kept seating people for more than 1/2 hour after the production started!!  This was very disruptive to the performance!!  It was as if they were pulling people in off the street after the show started.  They should have had the latecomers wait until one number ended and before the next one started!!

data.title: Nice place
data.text: I have been there only once, and its a nice theater. The people that work there are very nice and knowledgeable. They host a lot of pretty cool events there. Can't wait to go back.

data.title: The non superficial side of Miami
data.text:
i went last night to the Piano Festival at Colony Theater, right in the heart of the Miami Stupidity, you find this cozy, tiny and superb venue.
besides the point the Pianist were outstanding, this old and beautiful place in Lincoln Rd. is a must see if you visit Miami.

data.title: I don't want you to know about this place
data.text: I love going to shows here and having great seats for good prices. I want to support the Colony but don't want more people to go because it's so special.

data.title: Extraordinary venue
data.text: One of the rare places in Miami dedicated to non commercial, artistic and simply good shows. They also hold few festivals every year.

data.title: Average a fun show (5) with poor service (1) for 3 stars
data.text: Someone (NOT Ticketmaster) lost my PAID "will call" order. If I hadn't brought my receipt, who knows whether they would have let me in!  As it was, I had to do some firm talking. Each live show may be handled on a case by case basis, so don't let that deter you. The actual show (Shlomo,The Soul Doctor) was so much fun!  The facility was comfortable and I liked the Art Deco styling. The theater is right on the Lincoln pedestrian mall, which is convenient for making an evening of it.

data.title: Imperdível
data.text: Durante a caminhada na Lincoln Road deparei com esse teatro chamoso. Próximo da Starbucks. Imperdível.

data.title: vale a pena
data.text:
teatro em miami, preço bom, muito divertido.
indicado mais para ir em familias, prox ao centro de miami

data.title: Colony Theater
data.text: Excelente cinema localizado na Lincoln Road. Ótimas instalações e localização privilegiadíssima. Muitos bares e restaurantes nos arredores.

data.title: Da fotografare
data.text: non si può non fotografare questo teatro...sembra di essere totnati agli anni 50.....sulla strada lo si facilmente ma non andrei di proposito a cercarlo....
